benchmark_details.name: MRCEval
benchmark_details.overview: MRCEval is a comprehensive, challenging and accessible benchmark designed to assess the reading comprehension capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) using 2,103 high-quality multi-choice questions across 13 distinct RC skills.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for assessing the reading comprehension capabilities of large language models.

data.source: The benchmark is constructed using existing MRC datasets like SQuAD, DocRED, and others.
data.annotation: Automatically generated using LLMs and manually filtered for quality.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is reported as the metric from a single run result of models evaluated on the benchmark.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance of large language models on reading comprehension tasks.
methodology.validation: Quality detection filtering was performed on the origin data.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset includes measures for sensitive information filtering.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: MRCEval will be shared under the CC BY-SA 4.0 license.
